snippet: In Wood Colony, descendants of Anabaptist settlers farm in an unspoiled landscape and keep to the old ways. But they fear that is about to change.
abstract: Rural district of Wood Colony in California, community settled more than a century ago by a religious group called the Old German Baptist Brethren, is facing change; residents are fourth- and fifth-generation farmers who tend an unspoiled landscape and are hoping to stop plans by City of Modesto to bring about 1,800 acres of Wood Colony under city jurisdiction to develop.
lead_paragraph: In Wood Colony, descendants of Anabaptist settlers farm in an unspoiled landscape and keep to the old ways. But they fear that is about to change.

headline.main: A Timeless California Enclave Fears a City’s Sway
headline.print_headline: A Timeless California Enclave Fears a City’s Sway
